Conduits and pits shall be bedded on approved bedding material.

Bell mouths to be installed where possible and correctly colour coded.

Rope ends shall be firmly secured to prevent the ends being lost in a conduit.
Natural Gas Gastight Air Pressure Test - Test 2 @ 315kPa
Template Name: Natural Gas Gastight Air Pressure Test - Test 2 @ 315kPa

name: Ensure the system is disconnected at the meter or from the cylinder
Ensure all open ends are capped or plugged.
Ensure all gas appliances are isolated.
Connect a suitable test instrument. Serial No......
Raise pressure to 1.5 times the operating pressure to 315 kPa
Isolate the pressure source and allow suitable period 2 minutes for the temperature of the testing medium within the consumer piping to stabilise.
Measure the loss of pressure during the test period of 10 minutes
If no pressure loss during the 10 minute period the pipework can be considered gastight.
Weld Completed By:
values: Benjamin Habon, EB Lindayao, Jefferson Calla, Redennis Teves, Steve Reeves, William Sabino, Calvin Cheyne, Mark Bateman, John Chingkaw

name: Pre-weld checks - Visual Inspection of Pipe
Record pipe batch number as labelled on the pipe.
Record pipe wall thickness and inspect.
External surfaces are free from scratches deeper than 10% of wall thickness.
Inspect internal surface of pipe for scratches.
Inspect internal ridges or ripples exceeding 0.5mm in height.
Clean and wipe pipe with Isopropanol.
Inspect pipe ends are dry from any water content.
Heater plate temperature checks taken and recorded
Ensure pipe ends are capped, welding area isolated to regulate cooling and prevent airborne contaminants.
Alignment of pipes is less than 10% of pipe wall thickness?
Fusion beads symmetrical on both sides of weld
Ensure Beads are fully rolled over
Inspect for cracks in beads and welds are free of pitting and bubbling.
Inspect for inclusions or other obvious faults present.
Internal weld beads removed from pipe?
Data logger records printed, checked and attached?
Weld completed, inspected by AE Smith Supervisor and CPB ?
Post weld checks by CPB and AE Smith - Request Signoff/ Raise Remedial

3.5 - Works Completion Test WCT 82 Loss of mains.

Conformance Criteria - Simulate loss of mains supply by isolating the incoming mains supply. Verify The potable water pump operates to supply water in the event of loss of water supply from the site system. The test will evidence that the valve from the storage tank opens, the potable water pump starts up on generator power, and the pumps ramps up and down to maintain a pressurised potable water main to the New Waikeria Facility Site. Outlets within the New Waikeria Facility Site will be opened to simulate water consumption on the New Waikeria Facility Site. Independent reviewer to attend and witness
